data.enText: small mark
a small round area that has a different colour or feels different from the surface it is on
Which has spots, the leopard or the tiger?
The male bird has a red spot on its beak.

data.chText: 她穿着一条黑底白点的裙子。
data.enText: She was wearing a black skirt with white spots.
a small dirty mark on sth
His jacket was covered with spots of mud.
rust spots

data.chText: （皮肤上的）丘疹，疱疹，粉刺；脓疱
data.enText: a small mark or lump on a person's skin, sometimes with a yellow head to it

data.chText: 当时这孩子浑身布满小红疙瘩。
data.enText: The baby's whole body was covered in small red spots.

data.chText: 为长粉刺而烦恼的青少年
data.enText: teenagers worried about their spots
place
a particular area or place

data.chText: 宁静、僻静、偏僻等的地方
data.enText: a quiet/secluded/lonely, etc. spot

data.chText: 他把他当时向她求婚的确切地点指给我看。
data.enText: He showed me the exact spot where he had asked her to marry him.

data.chText: 她吓得呆若木鸡地站在那里。
data.enText: She stood rooted to the spot with fear (= unable to move) .
a tourist spot
small amount
a small amount of sth
He's in a spot of trouble.
a small amount of a liquid
I felt a few spots of rain.
part of show

data.chText: （电视、广播中或俱乐部、剧院演出中）某演员的固定节目，某类节目的固定栏目
data.enText: a part of a television, radio, club or theatre show that is given to a particular entertainer or type of entertainment
a guest/solo spot
in competition
a position in a competition or an event

data.chText: 争夺冠军地位的两个队
data.enText: two teams battling for top spot
light
in a (tight) spot
in a difficult situation
on the spot
immediately

data.chText: 他当场就回答了那个问题。
data.enText: He answered the question on the spot.

data.chText: 当场进行的违章停车罚款处罚
data.enText: an on-the-spot parking fine
at the actual place where sth is happening

data.chText: 几分钟之内，一辆救护车便赶到现场。
data.enText: An ambulance was on the spot within minutes.
an on-the-spot report
in place
in one exact place, without moving in any direction

data.chText: 原地跑步是一种很好的锻炼。
data.enText: Running on the spot is good exercise.
put sb on the spot

data.chText: （提出难题）使某人尴尬，使某人为难
data.enText: to make sb feel awkward or embarrassed by asking them a difficult question

data.chText: 采访者的问题使他很下不来台。
data.enText: The interviewer's questions really put him on the spot.
a/the bright spot

data.chText: （不幸或逆境中的）可喜部分，闪光点
data.enText: a good or pleasant part of sth that is unpleasant or bad in all other ways

data.chText: 上周的胜利是他们最近十场比赛中唯一振奋人心的一次。
data.enText: The win last week was the only bright spot in their last ten games.
glued to the spot

data.chText: 动弹不得；吓呆了；惊呆了
data.enText: not able to move, for example because you are frightened or surprised
hit the spot

data.chText: 发挥正当作用；适得其用；恰到好处
data.enText: if sth hits the spot it does exactly what it should do
knock spots off sb/sth

data.chText: 远远胜过某人（事物）；大大超过；使相形见绌
data.enText: to be very much better than sb/sth
a leopard cannot change its spots
people cannot change their character, especially if they have a bad character
be riveted to the spot/ground
to be so shocked or frightened that you cannot move
have a soft spot for sb/sth
to like sb/sth
She's always had a soft spot for you.

before.enText: not used in the progressive tenses

data.enText: to see or notice a person or thing, especially suddenly or when it is not easy to do so

data.chText: 我终于在人群中看见了我的朋友。
data.enText: I finally spotted my friend in the crowd.

data.chText: 我刚才在封面上发现了一处错误。
data.enText: I've just spotted a mistake on the front cover.

data.chText: 你能不能看出这两幅画有什么不同？
data.enText: Can you spot the difference between these two pictures?

data.chText: 邻居们发现有烟从这所房子里冒出来。
data.enText: Neighbours spotted smoke coming out of the house.

data.chText: 没有人留意到那是一支假枪。
data.enText: No one spotted that the gun was a fake.

data.chText: 我很快就看出错误所在了。
data.enText: I soon spotted what the mistake was.

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+名词短语

data.enText: to give your opponent or the other team an advantage
We spotted the opposing team two goals.
be spotted with sth
to be covered with small round marks of sth
His shirt was spotted with oil.

data.chText: 现货交易的；立即支付的
data.enText: connected with a system of trading where goods are delivered and paid for immediately after sale
spot prices
These are all words for a small part on a surface that is a different colour from the rest.
dot

data.chText: 指点、小点、小圆点，尤指印出来的点：
data.enText: a small round mark on sth, especially one that is printed
The letters ‘i’ and ‘j’ have dots over them.

data.chText: 这个岛在地图上是一个绿色的小点。
data.enText: The island is a small green dot on the map.
mark

data.chText: 指人或动物身上的斑、记号、色斑：
data.enText: a noticeable area of colour on the body of a person or animal
The horse had a white mark on its head.
spot
a small round area that is a different colour or feels different from the surface it is on
Which has spots, a leopard or a tiger?
a dot/mark/spot on sth
with dots/marks/spots
a blue/black/red, etc. dot/mark/spot

data.text: mark ♦ stain ♦ streak ♦ speck ♦ blot ♦ smear ♦ spot

data.chText: 以上各词均指污点、斑点、污迹。
data.enText: These are all words for a small area of dirt or another substance on a surface.
mark
a small area of dirt or other substance on the surface of sth, especially one that spoils its appearance

data.chText: 孩子们把厨房的地板弄得污迹斑斑。
data.enText: The kids left dirty marks all over the kitchen floor.
stain
a dirty mark on sth that is difficult to remove, especially one made by a liquid
blood stains
streak
a long thin mark or line that is a different colour from the surface it is on
She had streaks of grey in her hair.
speck
a very small mark, spot or piece of a substance on sth
There isn't a speck of dust anywhere in the house.
blot
a spot or dirty mark left on sth by a substance such as ink or paint being dropped on a surface
smear
a mark made by sth such as oil or paint being spread or rubbed on a surface
spot
a small dirty mark on sth
There were grease spots all over the walls.
a streak/speck/blot/smear/spot of sth
a dirty mark/stain/streak/speck/smear/spot
an ink mark/stain/blot/spot
a(n) oil/grease/paint mark/stain/spot
to leave a mark/stain/streak/speck/blot/smear/spot
to get a mark/stain/spot out of sth

data.text: place ♦ site ♦ position ♦ location ♦ scene ♦ spot ♦ venue

data.chText: 以上各词均表示地点、场所、位置。
data.enText: These are all words for a particular area or part of an area, especially one used for a particular purpose or where sb/sth is situated or happens.
place

data.chText: 指有特定用途或事情发生的地点、场所、城镇、建筑物、地方：
data.enText: a particular point, area, city, town, building, etc., especially one used for a particular purpose or where a particular thing happens

data.chText: 这可是个野餐的好地方。
data.enText: This would be a good place for a picnic.
site

data.chText: 尤指建筑物的地点、位置，事情发生或有特定用途的地点、场所：
data.enText: the place where sth, especially a building, is or will be situated; a place where sth happened or that is used for a particular purpose

data.chText: 他们为新学校选了校址。
data.enText: They've chosen a site for the new school.
position

data.chText: 指位置、方位、恰当的位置：
data.enText: the place where a person or thing is situated; the place where sb/sth is meant to be

data.chText: 他在山头那个位置可以俯瞰海港。
data.enText: From his position at the top of the hill, he could see the harbour.

data.chText: position指人／物所处的位置常常是暂时性的，即在某段时间所在的位置。
data.enText: The position of sb/sth is often temporary: the place where sb/sth is at a particular time.
location

data.chText: 指事情发生或存在的地方、地点、位置，尤指无名或鲜为人知的地方：
data.enText: a place where sth happens or exists, especially a place that is not named or not known
The company is moving to a new location.
scene

data.chText: 尤指不愉快事件发生的地点、现场：
data.enText: a place where sth happens, especially sth unpleasant
the scene of the accident
spot

data.chText: 尤指具有某种特点或某一事件发生的地点、场所：
data.enText: a particular point or area, especially one that has a particular character or where sth particular happens

data.chText: 这湖是当地的一个风景点。
data.enText: The lake is one of the local beauty spots .
venue

data.chText: 指演出、体育比赛等的聚会地点、场馆、会场
data.enText: the place where people meet for an organized event such as a performance or sports event
a/the place/site/position/location/scene of sth
at a/the place/site/position/location/scene/spot/venue
in a place/position/location/venue
the place/site/location/spot/venue where…
the right place/site/position/location/spot/venue
a prime/central place/site/position/location/venue
the/sb's/sth's current/present/exact/precise place/site/position/location/spot/venue

data.text: see ♦ spot ♦ catch ♦ glimpse ♦ clap/lay/set eyes on

data.chText: 以上各词均含看见、见到、看出之义，尤指突然发现或注意到。
data.enText: These words all mean to become aware of sb/sth by using your eyes, especially suddenly or when it is not easy to see them/it.
see
to become aware of sb/sth by using your eyes

data.chText: 她在人群里找来找去，但没看见他。
data.enText: She looked for him but couldn't see him in the crowd.
He could see (that) she had been crying.
spot

data.chText: 指看见、看出，尤指突然发现或注意到：
data.enText: to see or notice sb/sth, especially suddenly or when they are not easy to see or notice

data.chText: 我刚才在封面上发现了一处错误。
data.enText: I've just spotted a mistake on the front cover.
catch
to see or notice sth for a moment, but not clearly or completely
She caught sight of a car in the distance.

data.chText: 他看了一眼镜子中的自己。
data.enText: He caught a glimpse of himself in the mirror.
glimpse
( literary ) to see sb/sth for a moment, but not clearly or completely

data.chText: 他路过时透过窗户瞥见了她。
data.enText: He'd glimpsed her through the window as he passed.
clap/lay/set eyes on sb/sth

data.chText: （通常用于否定句中）指看见、注意到：
data.enText: ( informal ) (usually used in negative statements) to see sb/sth

data.chText: 我几个星期都没见到他们了。
data.enText: I haven't clapped eyes on them for weeks.
to see/spot that/how/what/where/who…
to suddenly see/spot/catch/glimpse sb/sth
can/could see
to fail to see/spot

word_means: 某演员的固定节目，某类节目的固定栏目

means: 某演员的固定节目，某类节目的固定栏目

ex.chText: 把钱放在安全的地方。
ex.enText: Put your money in a safe place.

ex.chText: 巴西面积很大。
ex.enText: Brazil is a big place.

ex.chText: 早先这里是一片不毛之地。
ex.enText: The place used to be a stretch of barren land.

ex.chText: 那家酒吧是我们碰面的老地方。
ex.enText: The bar was our usual meeting place.

ex.chText: 这是个观光游览的好地方。
ex.enText: This is a great place for sightseeing.

synonyms.bx: 普通用词，既可以指比较笼统的地方，又可以指某一具体的地点。

ex.chText: 他用笔在地图上标出了合恩角的位置。
ex.enText: He indicated the location of Cape Horn with a pen on the map.

ex.chText: 谁也不知道藏宝地点在哪里。
ex.enText: No one knows the location of the hidden treasure.

ex.chText: 我们将在指定的时间和地点见面。
ex.enText: We'll meet at a given time and location.

ex.chText: 救援人员需要知道飞机失事的确切地点。
ex.enText: The rescue workers needed the precise location of the crash.

ex.chText: 她想租一间位置很好的公寓。
ex.enText: She wants to rent an apartment in a really good location.

synonyms.bx: 尤指相对于其他建筑物、地区等而言某人或某物所处的地理位置。

ex.chText: 你能在这幅地图上找到我们学校的位置吗？
ex.enText: Can you find the position of our school on this map?

ex.chText: 学院靠着河，处于很好的位置。
ex.enText: The college is in a good position by the river.

ex.chText: 他在阳台上能够看到不错的海景。
ex.enText: From his position on the balcony, he had a good view of the sea.

ex.chText: 他在报告中重点强调了那个小岛的战略位置。
ex.enText: He emphasized the strategic position of that island in his report.

synonyms.bx: 指某人、某物相对于其他人、物或地方而言所处的方位。

ex.chText: 警察几分钟后就赶到了事发现场。
ex.enText: The police were on the scene within minutes.

ex.chText: 调查人员正在案发现场寻找线索。
ex.enText: Investigators are searching for clues at the scene of the crime.

synonyms.bx: 多指事故、罪案等不愉快事件发生的地点。

ex.chText: 滑铁卢战役的战场遗址在比利时。
ex.enText: The site of the battle of Waterloo is in Belgium.

ex.chText: 这家酒吧建在一个古代竞技场的遗址上。
ex.enText: The bar is built on the site of an ancient arena.

ex.chText: 他们在营地上搭起了帐篷。
ex.enText: They pitched their tent at the camping site.

ex.chText: 他们接到命令为基地建一处直升机降落场。
ex.enText: They were ordered to build a helicopter landing site for their base.

synonyms.bx: 既可指发生过重要或有趣事件的场所，也可指有专门用途的场地。

ex.chText: 海滩上有没有一个安静点儿的地方？
ex.enText: Is there a quiet spot on the beach?

ex.chText: 位于恬静宜人之处的一幢小村舍深深吸引了她。
ex.enText: She was deeply attracted by a small cottage in an idyllic spot.

ex.chText: 为什么你觉得这是野餐的理想地点呢？
ex.enText: Why do you think this is an ideal spot for a picnic?

ex.chText: 这就是他遇害的确切地点。
ex.enText: This is the exact spot where he was killed.

ex.chText: 颐和园是我们野餐的最佳地点。
ex.enText: The Summer Palace is the best spot for our picnic.

synonyms.bx: 指相对范围较小的特定地点，尤指休闲场所。

in a difficult situation
on the spot
immediately

at the actual place where sth is happening

data.chText: 几分钟之内，一辆救护车便赶到现场。
data.enText: An ambulance was on the spot within minutes.
an on-the-spot report
in place
in one exact place, without moving in any direction

data.chText: 原地跑步是一种很好的锻炼。
data.enText: Running on the spot is good exercise.
put sb on the spot

data.chText: （提出难题）使某人尴尬，使某人为难
data.enText: to make sb feel awkward or embarrassed by asking them a difficult question

data.chText: 采访者的问题使他很下不来台。
data.enText: The interviewer's questions really put him on the spot.
a/the bright spot

data.chText: （不幸或逆境中的）可喜部分，闪光点
data.enText: a good or pleasant part of sth that is unpleasant or bad in all other ways

data.chText: 上周的胜利是他们最近十场比赛中唯一振奋人心的一次。
data.enText: The win last week was the only bright spot in their last ten games.
glued to the spot

data.chText: 动弹不得；吓呆了；惊呆了
data.enText: not able to move, for example because you are frightened or surprised
hit the spot

data.chText: 发挥正当作用；适得其用；恰到好处
data.enText: if sth hits the spot it does exactly what it should do

data.chText: 远远胜过某人（事物）；大大超过；使相形见绌
data.enText: to be very much better than sb/sth
a leopard cannot change its spots
people cannot change their character, especially if they have a bad character
be riveted to the spot/ground
to be so shocked or frightened that you cannot move
have a soft spot for sb/sth
to like sb/sth
She's always had a soft spot for you.
be spotted with sth
to be covered with small round marks of sth
His shirt was spotted with oil.

tr: an act that brings discredit to the person who does it
example: he made a huge blot on his copybook

tr: a job in an organization
example: he occupied a post in the treasury

tr: a business establishment for entertainment
a playing card with a specified number of pips on it to indicate its value
a lamp that produces a strong beam of light to illuminate a restricted area
used to focus attention of a stage performer
a small contrasting part of something
a blemish made by dirt
example: he had a smudge on his cheek

tr: an outstanding characteristic
example: his acting was one of the high points of the movie

tr: a section of an entertainment that is assigned to a specific performer or performance
example: they changed his spot on the program

tr: a short section or illustration (as between radio or tv programs or in a magazine) that is often used for advertising
a mark on a die or on a playing card (shape depending on the suit)
a point located with respect to surface features of some region
example: this is a nice place for a picnic
a bright spot on a planet

tr: a small piece or quantity of something
example: I gave him a bit of my mind

tr: a slight attack of illness
example: he has a touch of rheumatism

tr: mark with a spot or spots so as to allow easy recognition
example: spot the areas that one should clearly identify

tr: become spotted
make a spot or mark onto
mar or impair with a flaw
catch sight of
detect with the senses
example: The fleeing convicts were picked out of the darkness by the watchful prison guards
I can't make out the faces in this photograph

value.def: Spots are small, round, coloured areas on a surface.

example.ex: The leaves have yellow areas on the top and underneath are powdery orange spots...
example.tran: 叶子的表面有黄色斑块，背面则有桔色粉状圆点。

example.ex: The swimsuit comes in navy with white spots or blue with green spots.
example.tran: 这款泳衣有藏青色带白色圆点的，也有蓝色带绿色圆点的。

value.def: Spots on a person's skin are small lumps or marks.

example.ex: Never squeeze blackheads, spots or pimples.
example.tran: 千万不要挤黑头、小肿块或粉刺。

value.def: A spot of a liquid is a small amount of it.

example.ex: Spots of rain had begun to fall...
example.tran: 雨点开始落下来了。

example.ex: Secure with a few spots of glue.
example.tran: 用几滴胶水粘住。

value.def: If you have a spot of something, you have a small amount of it.

example.ex: Mr Brooke is undoubtedly in a spot of bother...
example.tran: 布鲁克先生肯定遇到了点小麻烦。

example.ex: A year or two ago I found myself indulging in a spot of yachting in Finnish waters...
example.tran: 一两年前，我有一阵子曾迷上了在芬兰海域中进行帆船运动。

example.ex: We've given all the club members tea, coffee and a spot of lunch.
example.tran: 我们为所有俱乐部成员都提供了茶、咖啡和简单的午餐。

value.def: You can refer to a particular place as a spot .

example.ex: They stayed at several of the island's top tourist spots...
example.tran: 他们在岛上最著名的几处旅游景点作了停留。

example.ex: They all stood there staring, as if frozen to the spot.
example.tran: 他们都站在那儿发愣，就像被冻在那里似的。

value.def: A spot in a television or radio show is a part of it that is regularly reserved for a particular performer or type of entertainment.

example.ex: Unsuccessful at screen writing, he got a spot on a CNN film show.
example.tran: 写电影剧本未获成功后，他在美国有线新闻网的一档电影节目中争取到了一个固定时段。

value.def: If you spot something or someone, you notice them.

example.ex: Vicenzo failed to spot the error...
example.tran: 维森佐未能发现该错误。

example.ex: He left the party seconds before smoke was spotted coming up the stairs.
example.tran: 就在他离开聚会几秒钟后有人发现烟雾顺着楼梯冒上来了。

value.def: If you are on the spot, you are at the actual place where something is happening.

example.ex: ...areas where troops are on the spot and protecting civilians...
example.tran: 有部队在现场保护平民的地区

example.ex: Mr Connolly is their 'man on the spot' and the person you can call if you have a complaint.
example.tran: 康诺利先生是他们的“现场代表”，要投诉可以和他联系。

value.def: If you do something on the spot, you do it immediately.

example.ex: James was called to see the producer and got the job on the spot...
example.tran: 詹姆斯被叫去见制片人，当场就得到了那份工作。

example.ex: The surveyor will use a laptop computer to give on the spot advice.
example.tran: 检测员会用一台手提电脑当场给出意见。

value.def: If you put someone on the spot, you cause them to have to answer a difficult question or make a difficult decision.

example.ex: He put me on the spot a bit because he invited me right in front of his mum and I didn't particularly want to go...
example.tran: 他让我有点难堪，因为他当着他母亲的面邀请我，而我又不太想去。

example.ex: Even clever people are not terribly clever when put on the spot.
example.tran: 即便是聪明人在面对难题时也未必就能表现得特别聪明。

value.def: If you are in a tight spot, you are in a difficult situation.

example.ex: In a tight spot there is no one I would sooner see than Frank.
example.tran: 有麻烦时，我会首先去找弗兰克。

xrse.def: to have a soft spot for someone

trans: 多事之地；(尤指政治原因的)热点地区；活动多的地方；热闹的娱乐场所；火灾多发地区
